meanings.definition: In a deceitful or dishonest manner
meanings.sent1: He fraudulently altered the numbers to make it seem like he had more money.
meanings.sent2: The scammer fraudulently promised huge returns on investment.
meanings.sent3: The magician fraudulently made the rabbit disappear, but it was all just a trick.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as fraudulently bright as a fake diamond.
meanings.sent5: The con artist fraudulently convinced the old lady to give him all her savings.

meanings.definition: With intent to deceive or trick
meanings.sent1: She fraudulently claimed to be a doctor to get access to the medicine.
meanings.sent2: The thief fraudulently posed as a delivery person to enter the building.
meanings.sent3: The student fraudulently pretended to be sick to avoid taking the test.
meanings.sent4: The shadows in the alley moved fraudulently, hiding the true danger within.
meanings.sent5: The spy fraudulently obtained the secret documents under the cover of darkness.

meanings.sent1: The company fraudulently inflated their sales numbers to attract investors.
meanings.sent2: The hacker fraudulently accessed the sensitive information by bypassing security measures.
meanings.sent3: The cat fraudulently knocked over the vase and blamed it on the dog.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered fraudulently, hiding the impending disaster.
meanings.sent5: The politician fraudulently manipulated the data to support his agenda.
